channel.title: Obfuscated Jar Issues
channel.description:
How to fix error when running an Obfuscated Jar.....
Error giving: There is no NpcDef that exists...
So basically the client is trying to load shit from classes that wont be there... Well, they're there but obfuscated .. So they're not readable.

item.title: Obfuscated Jar Issues
item.dc:creator: @_uare ~uare
item.description:
@_uare wrote:

yong min:

If anyone has successfully obfuscated the rscd jar and then made the client runnable and is willing to share the information (maybe for $ too), please feel free to PM me or reply in this thread. This is frustrating now …

I’ve made it before, i would take money for that.
Its quite tricky since the mudclient cannot be obfuscated because its the main file.
ProGuard is the best program i’ve found this far.

I don’t have the time to assist you but go play with ProGuard.

Read full topic

item.title: Obfuscated Jar Issues
item.dc:creator: @waj waj
item.description:
@waj wrote:

I had the same problem, my error was

Exception in thread "Thread-3" a.a.a.e.f: name : name ---- Debugging information ---- message : name : name line number : 3 path : /NPCDef-array/NPCDef/name cause-message : name : name class : [Lorg.rscdaemon.client.entityhandling.defs.NPCDef; cause-exception : a.a.a.b.x required-type : org.rscdaemon.client.entityhandling.defs.NPCDef -------------------------------

Read full topic

item.title: Obfuscated Jar Issues
item.dc:creator: @vortex vortex
item.description:
@vortex wrote:

[quote=“yong min, post:4, topic:432306”][quote author=vortex link=topic=535017.msg3911512#msg3911512 date=1328788284]
Your XML config files are referring to NPCDef and not the obfuscated name. Fix that and it might work.
[/quote]

There aren’t any XML config files in the client?[/quote]Uhh yes there are, “Npcs.rscd” or whatever they’re named is a gzipped XML file.

Read full topic
